result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel E. Schmitt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel E. Schmitt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel E. Schmitt was found guilty of Theft by Contractor (fr. Person/Corpse), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: Court orders 1 year conditional jail time, with huber, to be used at the DOC's discretion if DE fails to make regular monthly payments toward his restitution.

10:19 am - DA calls case and states appearances.  Defendant Daniel E. Schmitt appeared telephonically from Los Angeles, California with attorney Andrew M. Morgan appearing in person.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions DE regarding not being here.  DE states that he can be here Tuesday, 4/10/18.  DA states facts of case regarding restitution that needed to paid per agreement and has not been.  DA requests a pre-sentence investigation.  Response by Atty Morgan. Court so orders.  A hearing will be set on Tuesday, June 5, 2018.  DE needs to be here in person that date or Court will order warrant.

records.addlTxt: 11:16 am- Court calls case and DA states appearances and agreement reached.  Defendant Daniel E. Schmitt appeared with attorney James Richard Lex.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA certifies victims rights compliance.  Sentencing to be set off for 6 months as DE is scheduled to make restitution payments to DA's office during this time.  A waiver of preliminary hearing has already happened.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of GUILTY to count 1.  Court questions DE regarding the plea and plea questionnaire.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and on motion of DA, dismisses Cts 2-4.  To be set for sentencing at a future date.  Bond to continue.

1:52 - Defendant Daniel E. Schmitt in court with attorney James Richard Lex.  Defendant in custody.  Mark T. Fuhr appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  Lex presents waiver of preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary exam.  Court finds waiver to be free and voluntary, accepts the waiver.  Parties have received , reviewed information and waive its reading, with Lex noting additional counts charged.  Court quashes warrant  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts.

If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.  Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.  DE may not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior approval of the Court.
